column5: jayM5209.......Just repeat the swearing in process that I posted for Bozotheclown........Finished? Good, welcome to N.A.R.D.A.!!!!! On behalf of all the Nardarians every where, welcome to the best group of friends and fisherman around. As far as shirt, if any one has interest send NARDA 1 a message.

Thank you fellow Narda members for inviting me into one of the most exclusive clubs in Canada.I pledge to act in good faith and preserve and protect the NARDA name and values.I will respect and protect the NARDA plaque that now hangs on the wall of the pool room,which is under heavily armed security.

For you guys that like Crown Royal or CC, you need to pick up a bottle of Forty Creek. Crown Royal used to be my favorite, but now, I would take Forty Creek over any other Canadian Rye. Try it and let me know what you think. I am enjoying it right now.

When in Canada our preference is Hiram Walker Special Old, In the states it would be Rittenhouse orTempleton. We tried Forty Creek while we were at Birch Dale (they make their BBQ sauce for their ribs with it, very good) two years ago but prefer the Special Old.

I have been reading your posts and feel like one of the group.Cheryl has informed me that the bar will be stocked and ready for your grand entrance.When I mentioned the Narda group to Greg,he just had a good laugh.BTW,I now know the real meaning of NARDA!!!!!!!!!! PS.When driving back home,94 had a 8-10 mile constuction zone just south of Osseo,Wisconsin.Also,I went through both Canada and US customs in lessthan 60-70 seconds.Good luck to you guys....the muskies are hungry.
Thanks for the heads up on the construction. We still have 25 days, 10 hours, 39 minutes and 32 seconds before we head up there.

Mr. Bozo, As equipment manager for N.A.R.D.A. ( I am known as N.A.R.D.A III ) I will swear you in to the group. Do you swear to forget about work when you are fishing, to relax and enjoy your friends company, drink as muck Rye or as little Rye as you can handle for your stay in Canada, admit that you count every day all year until you leave for your next trip and have at least one foggy morning after drinking Rye all night as it does not seem to give you a hang over and last but least remember these words........North American Rye Drinkers Association....Good Friends, Good Times, Good Rye.....What happens in Canada, Stays in Canada! Please state " I do ". You are now an official member of N.A.R.D.A.!!!!!!! Welcome! Thanks, N.A.R.D.A. III
I have my NARDA shirt packed can't wait to drink a RYE from my tumbler in one week.
Keep the faith Dan. Have a great trip!!!
I second Danbear. Cannot wait for the first glass of rye at birchdale. My NARDA shirt is also packed.
Boynurse and Danbear, tell Cheryl to put your first one on my tab.
Does an Old Overholt now and then make me eligible for membership?
Sure, I'll have our equipment manager swear you in. NARDA III do your thing.

What's this I hear Danbear has a shirt and I don't,I could have used an extra layer(or 2 or 3) last year.Danbear,tell Marcel you want to take a camp boat to Clearwater,tell him you heard Jamie/Jay had no problem getting back there but you would rather take 1 of his,long story short didn't make it in my boat,had to turn around at our 3rd beaver dam and $400 damage to LU/prop.12" or so crack in the cav.plate and a FUBAR'ed prop but still limp'ed it another day and a half.
